uno.player

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • uno.player.Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Player_ScottS

    public abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The abstract class Player provides a base class from which all player classes must be derived. Each of the abstract methods must be implemented.
    Version:
    v1.0 April 8, 2015
    Author:
    S. Sigman

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      protected Hand hand

      This method constructs s a new player object.

      The numberOfCards method reports the number of cards in the player's hand.
      abstract int play(UNO_Card card, boolean useColorInstead)
      Deprecated. 
      The useColorInstead parameter is deprecated. It is currently supported, but will go away in later releases.

      The scoreOnCards method reports the score of the cards in the player's hand.
      abstract java.lang.String whoAreYou()
      The whoAreYou method reports the player object's name.

    • Field Detail

      • dealer

        protected Game_Engine dealer

      • hand

        protected Hand hand

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(Hand hand,
              Game_Engine dealer)
        This method constructs s a new player object. The player object constructed has the specified hand of cards and a reference to the dealer who dealt the hand.
        Parameters:
        hand - The hand of UNO_Cards.
        dealer - A reference to the Game_Engine object that is controling the game play.

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public abstract int play(UNO_Card card,
                         boolean useColorInstead)
        Deprecated. The useColorInstead parameter is deprecated. It is currently supported, but will go away in later releases.
        The play method must be implemented by the derived player class. It must conform to the rules specified in the assignment design.
        Parameters:
        card - The top card on the discard pile.
        useColorInstead - If true this flag indicates that the player should query the dealer for the current color and use this information instead of card on top of the draw pile to make their play. If false, use the card passed via the card parameter as the top card on the draw pile.
        Returns:
        The number of cards remaining in the players hand after the player object has played.

      • whoAreYou

        public abstract java.lang.String whoAreYou()
        The whoAreYou method reports the player object's name.
        Returns:
        The name of the player.

      • scoreOnCards

        public abstract int scoreOnCards()
        The scoreOnCards method reports the score of the cards in the player's hand. It should only be called after a game has been one. The score should be calculated using standard UNO scoring rules.
        Returns:
        The value of the cards in the player's hand when the method is called.

      • numberOfCards

        public int numberOfCards()
        The numberOfCards method reports the number of cards in the player's hand.
        Returns:
        The number of cards in the player's hand.
